suncertify.db.data
Class URLyBirdHotel

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.data.URLyBirdHotel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class URLyBirdHotel
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This is an Object that represents a URLyBirdObject and its Serializable if used in a networked environment. Its hold data member and function necessary in make up of each Hotel record in the database.

Author:
Segun
See Also:

Constructor Detail

URLyBirdHotel

public URLyBirdHotel(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> limit,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String loc,
                     int s,
                     char sm,
                     double rate,
                     java.lang.String date)
              throws InvalidFieldLengthException
This Constructor set values of some of the class member thats needed when a new hotel is to be added to the database for booking. The required values to be stored in the database are passed into the constructor argument

Parameters:
limit - - a Map collection holding the integer value of all respective field name
name - - the Hotel name
loc - - the City which the Hotel resides
s - - the Maximum occupation of the room. as in size of occupants it can admit
sm - - character 'Y' for yes if the room allows smoking or 'N' if smoking not allowed
rate - - a double value of the price per night of the hotel
date - - a Date value of the room availability in format is yyyy/mm/dd
Throws:
InvalidFieldLengthException - - If the argument values respective length exceeds the required length

URLyBirdHotel

public URLyBirdHotel(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> limit,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String loc,
                     int s,
                     char sm,
                     double rate,
                     java.lang.String date,
                     long owner,
                     int flag)
              throws InvalidFieldLengthException
This constructor set values of some of the class members thats needed when reading values the data from the database which an instance of this class can be stored in a memory cache for this Object modification, control and all using the setter and getter. The required values to be stored in the database are passed into the constructor argument

Note that : Instance of this Object assigns default values to the member data lockCookie to 0 and the lockStatus to false (means the URLyBirdHotel object not locked).

Parameters:
limit - - a Map collection holding the integer value of all respective field name
name - - the Hotel name
loc - - the City which the Hotel resides
s - - the Maximum occupation of the room. as in size of occupants it can admit
sm - - character 'Y' for yes if the room allows smoking or 'N' if smoking not allowed
rate - - a double value of the price per night of the hotel
date - - a date value of the room availability in format is yyyy/mm/dd
owner - - a long value of the customer id that booked this Hotel
flag - - an Integer value that denotes the Hotel record status if Valid or Deleted
Throws:
InvalidFieldLengthException - - If the argument values respective length exceeds the required length

URLyBirdHotel

public URLyBirdHotel(java.lang.String[] data)
              throws InvalidRecordException,
                     InvalidFieldLengthException
This Constructor call sets the fields of this Object which represent a record. The value for field n appears in data[n]

Parameters:
data - - array of String that each index is a record value to the field name, location, size, smoking, rate, dateAvailable and owner id respectively
Throws:
InvalidRecordException - - throws this exception if the length of the array of string in argument is not 6 which each index modifies its respective member data
InvalidFieldLengthException - - If the argument values respective length exceeds the required length

setSmoking

public void setSmoking(char s)
                throws InvalidFieldLengthException
Set the smoking status of the Hotel room, a character value is passed into the function to set 'Y' if smoking room or 'N' if non smoking is allowed.

Parameters:
s - - character 'Y' for yes if the room allows smoking or 'N' if smoking not allowed
Throws:
InvalidFieldLengthException - - If the argument String value length exceeds the required length

setOwnerId

public void setOwnerId(long id)
                throws InvalidFieldLengthException
Sets the customer Id number which is an 8digits unique long value for every URLyBird customer A booked hotel has its owner if set to this customer id provided

Parameters:
id - - a long value (8 digits) that represent the customer id who booked this hotel
Throws:
InvalidFieldLengthException - - If the argument long value is not length of 8

setFlag

public void setFlag(int f)
Sets a new flag value for the Hotel Data... 0 if data is still valid and 1 if Deleted

Parameters:
f - - an Integer value denoting the data status, 0 if valid and 1 if its deleted

status - - a boolean value to set the lock status of the object. true to lock and false if to be unlocked

getUniqueKeys

public java.lang.String[] getUniqueKeys()
Making choices of Unique key fields as the Hotel Name and Location. Same Hotel Name (branch) in same location must not exist more than once in the database. So, this function gets the Unique key value of this object

Returns:
- array of string, first element is the Hotel Name and second element is the Location

toStringArray

public java.lang.String[] toStringArray(int recNo)
Return an array of String which contains all field member value of this Object placed into each element of the array including the record number good to be used to present record on a JTable

Parameters:
recNo - - the record number value of this URLBirdHotel object in the overall database. this is its primary key
Returns:
- an array of String value of all data member populated into index of an array with its primary record number key
